<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 390, 89]]<|/det|>
Show that the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 98, 606, 116]]<|/det|>
\[14x - 4y + 6z = 5,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[468, 119, 606, 137]]<|/det|>
\[x + y + kz = 3,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 139, 603, 158]]<|/det|>
\[-21x + 6y - 9z = 14,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 917, 183]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant, does not have a unique solution and interpret this situation geometrically. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the roots of the equation \((z + 5\mathrm{i})^{3} = 4 + 4\sqrt{3}\mathrm{i}\), giving your answers in the form \(r\cos \theta +\mathrm{i}(r\sin \theta -5)\), where \(r > 0\) and \(0< \theta < 2\pi\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 96, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 78, 915, 120]]<|/det|>
Find the first three terms in the Maclaurin's series for \(\tanh^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{2}\mathrm{e}^{x}\right)\) in the form \(\frac{1}{2}\ln a + bx + cx^2\) , giving the exact values of the constants \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 917, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 544, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[421, 100, 613, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} +2\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} +3y = 27x^{2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 147, 470, 176]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(x = 0\), \(y = 2\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = -8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 155, 920, 173]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 416, 89]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 98, 712, 121]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{2}{3} t^{\frac{3}{2}} - 2t^{\frac{1}{2}}, \qquad y = 2t + 5, \qquad \text{for } 0 < t \leqslant 3.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 144, 151]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 368, 151]]<|/det|>
Find the exact length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 146, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 515, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(t\) for which \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} > 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 792, 90]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of cosh and sinh in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 102, 636, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\sinh 2x = 2\sinh x\cosh x. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 413, 141, 432]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 406, 620, 435]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = \sinh x\), find \(\int \sinh^2 2x \cosh x \, \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 413, 920, 432]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 584, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 94, 633, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y\tanh x = \sinh^2 2x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 131, 698, 151]]<|/det|>
given that \(y = 4\) when \(x = 0\). Give your answer in the form \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 131, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 316, 89]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 97, 599, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} -6 & 2 & 13 \\ 0 & -2 & 5 \\ 0 & 0 & 8 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 180, 146, 198]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 178, 675, 198]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^{-1} = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 375, 920, 421]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \cos x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n\) rectangles of width \(\frac{1}{n}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 428, 144, 447]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 425, 672, 448]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 459, 695, 500]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{1}\cos x\mathrm{d}x< \frac{1}{2n}\Bigg(1 - \cos 1 + \frac{\sin 1\sin\frac{1}{n}}{1 - \cos\frac{1}{n}}\Bigg). \quad [4]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 720, 143, 739]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 714, 730, 744]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound for \(\int_{0}^{1} \cos x \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 720, 920, 739]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 73, 564, 88]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
